com.googlecode.sarasvati.event
Interface ExecutionEventQueue

All Known Implementing Classes:
CachingExecutionEventQueue, DefaultExecutionEventQueue, InitialExecutionEventQueue
public interface ExecutionEventQueue

An ExecutionEventQueue manages a set of ExecutionListeners. It handles adding and removing listeners as well as sending events to the appropriate listeners.

Author:
Paul Lorenz

Method Summary
 void addListener(Engine engine, Class<? extends ExecutionListener> listenerClass, ExecutionEventType... eventTypes)
          Adds the given listener type to the event queue for the given event types using the given engine.
 EventActions fireEvent(ExecutionEvent event)
          Sends the event to the appropriate listeners.
 void removeListener(Engine engine, Class<? extends ExecutionListener> listenerClass, ExecutionEventType... eventTypes)
          Removes the given listener type from the event queue for the given event types using the given engine.
 

Method Detail

addListener

void addListener(Engine engine,
                 Class<? extends ExecutionListener> listenerClass,
                 ExecutionEventType... eventTypes)
Adds the given listener type to the event queue for the given event types using the given engine.

Parameters:
engine - The engine being used
listenerClass - The type of listener to add
eventTypes - The event types the listener should receive event notifications for

removeListener

void removeListener(Engine engine,
                    Class<? extends ExecutionListener> listenerClass,
                    ExecutionEventType... eventTypes)
Removes the given listener type from the event queue for the given event types using the given engine.

Parameters:
engine - The engine being used
listenerClass - The type of listener to add
eventTypes - The event types the listener should receive event notifications for

fireEvent

Sends the event to the appropriate listeners.

Parameters:
event - The execution event
